meanings.definition: In a manner that refers to the range of objects to which a term applies.
meanings.sent1: She explained the concept extensionally, covering all possible scenarios.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to think extensionally about the topic.
meanings.sent3: The detective's investigation extended extensionally, reaching every corner of the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: Her influence in the community spread extensionally, touching the lives of many.
meanings.sent5: The map displayed the city's boundaries extensionally, showing the entire area it covered.

meanings.definition: In a way that denotes the physical lengthening or stretching of something.
meanings.sent1: He pulled the rubber band extensionally until it snapped.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast stretched extensionally before her performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat yawned extensionally, showing off its sharp teeth.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches reached extensionally towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was pulled extensionally to test its durability.
